official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide a refundable tax credit for qualifying security devices.

summary.text: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to provide a refundable income tax credit equal to 15 percent of the purchase and installation price of a security device placed in a building or residence. Allows a maximum credit of $400. Includes as security devices eligible for such credit locks and fire, smoke, temperature, gas, anti-theft, anti-intrusion, and personal health emergency alarms. Excludes bars, screens, and other physical barriers.
